handNote.p: Main hand (margin): this scribe is probably the one mainly responsible for the main part of the marginalia in this MS, but the habit differs from his earlier work: raised f, k, and round s and exclusively long s and curly t suddenly appear; frequent corrections on or over erasure, as erasures generally do not create lacunae.
Reviser: few interventions by this hand in a very dark ink (contemporary or not even medieval?).

s.w: ge &et; and ſƿara t ſ t
